FacilityName: Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative - Bloomfield, NE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Policy: The owners, management and employees of Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative, N/S are committed to the prevention of 

any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local

fire department and law enforcement personnel to mitigate any releases to the population and the environment of our community.



2. Facility Information: This Farmers Pride Cooperative facility has 8 full time employees. The primary activity at this location

is storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received and stored while awaiting distribution to farmers.

Bulk storage tanks, and Nurse tanks are the  vessels used for the storage of anhydrous ammonia at this location. During periods of non-operation of this 

facility, local law enforcment conducts inspections at various times of the day and night. Anything out of the ordinary is reported to 

our 24 hour number and appropriate action is taken.



3. Worst-Case Release Senario: The worst-case release senario would be the release of the total contents of onr of the storage tanks

Details on our worst-case release senario may be found in Section 2 of this Risk Managment Plan.



4. Altermative-Case Release Senario: The alternative-case release senario is a release from a transfer hose failure. Details on our

alternative-case release senario may be found in Section 3 of the Risk Managment Plan.



5. Accidental Release Prevention Program: This facility has implemented the provisions of " Safety Requirements for the Storage and

Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the Standard of the U.S.

Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR Part 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.



6. Five Year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused

any deaths, injuries,

or significant property damage at the facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries,

evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.



7. Emergency Response Program: Our facility has coordinated withe the local responders and we do not plan to have our employees 

respond to any major release.



8. Planned Changes to Improve Safety: Safety improvements are an ongoing process at our facility. Periotic evaluations are

performed to asess our prevention and safety programs. No changes are planned at this time.



9. For additional information contact: Dawn Pochop, Safety and Regulatory, Farmers Pride Cooperative, Battle Creek, NE 68715

(402) 675-2375.
